sanction.client¶

class sanction.client.Client(adapter, config, flow=None)¶

A convenience class to assist dealing with an OAuth2 flow.

Parameters:
  • adapter – The adapter to use with this Client instance. Must be a child class (not an instance of) sanction.adapters.BaseAdapter.
  • flow – A valid subclass of sanction.flow.ResourceFlow (which is the base class for all OAuth2 flows). Will default to sanction.flow.AuthorizationRequestFlow which is used for web server-based flows.
adapter¶

The adapter instance bound to the Client instance.

Possibly the most useful thing that you can get from this is the :prop:`sanction.adapters.BaseAdapter.credentials` for the current adapter. This will be available once a user has been authenticated by the OAuth2 provider and should be set when your application requests resources for a user who’s already logged in (in order to avoid stateless requests).

This accessor can be used to query the adapter directly. See sanction.adapters for further details as attributes may vary by adapter implementation.

flow¶

The OAuth2 flow being used by the Client instance.

This access can be used to operate on the current OAuth2 flow. For further details, see sanction.flow. To really understand what’s going on in a given flow, it’s important to have a solid understanding of the entire `OAuth2 protocol`_. However, this should not be typically used by the average user as flows are handled automatically.
